entry.title: Payment Protocol for Face-to-face Payments
entry.summary: During a conversation between Andreas Schildbach and an unknown individual on March 21, 2014, Schildbach quoted from RFC 3986, Section 3.4 regarding the use of characters within the query component of a URI. Specifically, he referenced the fact that the characters slash ("/") and question mark ("?") may represent data within the query component. The other individual then asked about using BIP72 with a BT URI in the 'r' parameter, to which Schildbach responded affirmatively.
